intro: Verbesina cajamarcensis, commonly known as the Peruvian ironweed, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Verbesina cajamarcensis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
